meanings.definition: To drop personnel or supplies by parachute.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers paradrop into the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The pilot will paradrop the aid to the stranded hikers.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to paradrop from the tree with an umbrella.
meanings.sent4: Her words paradrop into my heart, bringing comfort.
meanings.sent5: The colorful parachutes paradrop gracefully from the sky.

meanings.definition: The act of dropping personnel or supplies by parachute.
meanings.sent1: The paradrop was successful, delivering the supplies safely.
meanings.sent2: We watched the paradrop of the rescue team from afar.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party had a paradrop of candies for the kids.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a paradrop of sunshine on a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The grand finale of the show was a paradrop of confetti.
